statements: UPDATE customer_information SET first_name='John', last_name='Doe', address='123 Main St', phone_number='555-1234' WHERE customer_id=1;
UPDATE customer_information SET phone_number='555-5678', address='456 Elm St', first_name='Jane', last_name='Smith' WHERE customer_id=2;
UPDATE customer_information SET first_name='John', last_name='Doe' WHERE customer_id=1;
UPDATE customer_information SET address='123 Main St, City' WHERE customer_id=2;
UPDATE customers SET first_name = 'John', last_name = 'Doe' WHERE customer_id = 1;
UPDATE accounts SET account_balance = 500.00 WHERE account_id = 100;
UPDATE customers SET first_name = 'John', last_name = 'Doe', address = '123 Main St', phone_number = '555-1234' WHERE customer_id = 1;
UPDATE accounts SET account_balance = 5000.00 WHERE customer_id = (SELECT customer_id FROM customers WHERE first_name = 'Alice');
UPDATE customers SET address = '123 Main St' WHERE customer_id = 1;
UPDATE accounts SET balance = balance - 1000 WHERE account_id = 100;
UPDATE customers SET first_name='Alice', last_name='Jones', address='123 Main St', email='alice.jones@example.com' WHERE customer_id=1;
UPDATE accounts SET balance=1500.00, account_type='Savings' WHERE customer_id=2;
UPDATE customers SET first_name = 'John', last_name = 'Doe', email = 'john.doe@example.com' WHERE id = 1;
UPDATE accounts SET opened_date = '2022-05-15', balance = 5000.00, account_type = 'Savings' WHERE account_id = 100;
UPDATE customers SET first_name='John', last_name='Doe', email='john.doe@example.com' WHERE id=1;
UPDATE accounts SET balance=1500.75, account_type='Savings' WHERE customer_id=3;
UPDATE customers SET address='123 Main St' WHERE customer_id=1;
UPDATE accounts SET balance=5000.00 WHERE account_id=101;
UPDATE customers SET first_name = 'John', last_name = 'Doe', address = '123 Main St', phone_number = '555-1234' WHERE customer_id = 1;
UPDATE accounts SET balance = balance + 1000.00 WHERE account_id = 101;
